agents.description: [DEPRECATED - use docs-keeper instead] Bootstrap, discover, update, and validate project documentation.
agents.name: docs-builder

agents.description: [DEPRECATED - use docs-keeper instead] Generate, audit, or migrate documentation.
agents.name: docs-generator

agents.description: Create a verifiable, executable plan (actions.json + traceability + verification checklist). Use before any implementation work.
agents.name: action-planner

agents.description: Implement non-test code changes assigned by actions.json, within declared file scope. Use for production code changes (not tests).
agents.name: implementor

agents.description: Write or update tests assigned by actions.json and project conventions (tests-only by default). Use when tests are required or failing.
agents.name: tests-builder

agents.description: Verify acceptance criteria and checklist items with evidence, producing a binary APPROVE/REJECT decision.
agents.name: compliance-checker

agents.description: Unified documentation management agent. Maintains documentation as a living contract through bootstrap, sync, update, discover, generate, and audit modes. Supports LSP for enhanced code understanding.
agents.name: docs-keeper

agents.description: Run configured quality commands from .claude/project.yaml (format/lint/typecheck/test/build/e2e) and capture evidence for the session.
agents.name: quality-gate

agents.description: Interactive ideation agent with user stories, traceability matrix, SRP/DRY/KISS compliance, and plugin-aware recommendations.
agents.name: ideation

agents.description: Run LSP-based semantic verification checks declared in planning/actions.json (acceptance_criteria.verification.type='lsp') and write deterministic evidence artifacts under quality/.
agents.name: lsp-verifier

agents.description: Review changes for correctness, plan compliance, and policy adherence. Verifies all planned tasks and acceptance criteria are implemented.
agents.name: reviewer

agents.description: Reproduce and isolate issues, confirm root cause, and propose fix + prevention. Produces analysis/root_cause.md.
agents.name: root-cause-analyzer

agents.description: Guide Test-Driven Development through Red-Green-Refactor cycles. Use with `/at:run deliver --tdd` for test-first feature development.
agents.name: tdd-guide

agents.description: Audit analysis phases (triage, ideate) for issue investigation, option exploration, and recommendation quality
agents.name: analysis-auditor
agents.notes: Only needed if you keep the session-auditor subsystem.

agents.description: Aggregate audit results from phase auditors, calculate overall scores, and generate recommendations
agents.name: audit-aggregator
agents.notes: Only needed if you keep the session-auditor subsystem.

agents.description: Audit the compliance verification phase, analyzing acceptance criteria verification and approval decisions
agents.name: compliance-auditor
agents.notes: Only needed if you keep the session-auditor subsystem.

agents.description: Audit the planning phase of a workflow session, analyzing actions.json structure, context selection, and task breakdown quality
agents.name: planning-auditor
agents.notes: Only needed if you keep the session-auditor subsystem.

agents.description: Audit the quality gate phase, analyzing command execution, pass/fail results, and coverage metrics
agents.name: quality-auditor
agents.notes: Only needed if you keep the session-auditor subsystem.

agents.description: Audit the code review phase, analyzing review thoroughness, finding quality, and feedback actionability
agents.name: review-auditor
agents.notes: Only needed if you keep the session-auditor subsystem.

agents.description: Audit individual implementation/test tasks, analyzing context usage, tool efficiency, and completion status
agents.name: task-auditor
agents.notes: Only needed if you keep the session-auditor subsystem.

Prefer Python-only hooks to avoid Node dependency.
Prefer Python-only hooks to avoid Node dependency.
Prefer Python-only hooks to avoid Node dependency.

js_files.description: Utility functions for hooks and scripts
js_files.notes: Prefer Python-only hooks to avoid Node dependency.
Optional UX: debug-statement reminder; can be rewritten in Python.

python_files.notes: Appears unused + schema drift vs current task artifacts; remove in rebuild.

python_files.description: I/O utilities for file operations and timestamps
Add version headers to all plugin files
Build context pack for agent workflows
Build per-task context slices from actions.json
Enforce file scope restrictions on Write/Edit tools
Subagent stop hook for artifact validation

python_files.notes: Not referenced by workflows; keep only if docs generation needs it.
Nice-to-have (sections indexing); not required for core deliver.

python_files.description: Audit logging hook for tool and agent tracking
Resolve agent paths for custom agents
Portable Claude Code Hook: Policy Enforcement (at)
Install at policy enforcement hooks into a Claude Code project or user scope.
Parse and extract data from audit log files
Generate audit reports in markdown and JSON
Extract detailed subagent data from audit logs

python_files.notes: Only needed if you move orchestration into Python (state machine); otherwise skip.
Only needed if you move orchestration into Python (state machine); otherwise skip.
Only needed if you move orchestration into Python (state machine); otherwise skip.
Only needed if you move orchestration into Python (state machine); otherwise skip.

python_files.description: Portable Claude Code Hook: Session Lifecycle Audit (at)
Portable Claude Code Hook: Subagent Lifecycle Audit (at)
Portable Claude Code Hook: Tool Usage Audit (at)
Claude Code Hook: Auto-Approve Session File Edits (at)
God class detection (portable, no third-party deps).
Architecture boundary enforcement (portable, no third-party deps).
Run at enforcement checks for a repo (fail-the-gate by default).
Install at audit hooks into a Claude Code project or user scope.
Install god class detection for at.
Install repo-specific project pack rules and (optional) enforcement for at.
Upgrade project to latest plugin version

skills.description: Validate and auto-fix .claude/project.yaml and tool availability for at
skills.name: doctor

skills.description: Generate a project overlay for at (CLAUDE.md, .claude/rules, .claude/project.yaml) for Python/Go/TypeScript/Rust
skills.name: init-project

skills.description: Run a contract-driven workflow (deliver/triage/review/ideate) with always-on sessions and quality/compliance gates
skills.name: run

skills.description: Show a session progress report and the recommended next step (best-effort; supports resume workflows)
skills.name: session-progress

skills.description: List at sessions (reads workflow.sessions_dir and prints session id/workflow/status/updated_at)
skills.name: sessions

skills.description: Manage project documentation - bootstrap, generate from codebase analysis with LSP, sync registry, audit coverage.
skills.name: docs

skills.description: Install and configure Claude Code policy enforcement hooks (fail-the-gate) to block secrets access and dangerous commands based on .claude/project.yaml policies. Use when hardening a project, enforcing no-.env access, preventing destructive shell commands, or enabling corporate-grade guardrails.
skills.name: policy-hooks-deployer
skills.notes: Consolidate into one command (keep one name, keep other as alias).

skills.description: [DEPRECATED - use /at:docs instead] Manual registry management. Registry is now auto-maintained.
skills.name: registry

skills.description: Resolve a failing quality check from quality/quality_report.json by fixing root cause and re-running the failing command deterministically
skills.name: resolve-failed-quality

skills.description: Install and configure at policy enforcement hooks (opt-in) to block secrets access and dangerous commands
skills.name: setup-policy-hooks
skills.notes: Consolidate into one command (keep one name, keep other as alias).

skills.description: Test-Driven Development workflow skill for implementing features using Red-Green-Refactor cycle
skills.name: tdd-workflow

skills.description: Uninstall at hooks from Claude Code settings (audit/policy)
skills.name: uninstall-hooks

skills.description: Run comprehensive verification checks before PR
skills.name: verify

skills.description: Analyze Claude Code audit logs under .claude/audit_logs (sessions/tools/subagents/traces) for observability and debugging
skills.name: audit

skills.description: Install and configure Claude Code hooks for tool/session/subagent auditing (writes JSONL logs under .claude/audit_logs). Use when setting up hooks, enabling audit logging, deploying hook scripts, or preparing for agent management/observability.
skills.name: audit-hooks-deployer
skills.notes: Consolidate into one command (keep one name, keep other as alias).

skills.description: Clean up old sessions based on retention policy (max age and count)
skills.name: cleanup-sessions

skills.description: Automatically extract reusable patterns from Claude Code sessions and save them for future use
skills.name: continuous-learning

skills.description: Scan codebase for god classes (SRP violations) and generate refactoring suggestions. Configurable thresholds for SLOC, methods, dependencies, and reasons-to-change.
skills.name: god-class-audit

skills.description: Display comprehensive help for at. Shows available commands, workflows, common use cases, and links to detailed documentation. Use when you need guidance on how to use the plugin effectively.
skills.name: help

skills.description: Wizard to import an existing repository into at with auto-detection of tooling, docs, and guided configuration
skills.name: import-repo
skills.notes: Merge into one import wizard; avoid duplicate flows.

skills.description: Show the current automatic learning/memory status for this project (at)
skills.name: learning-status

skills.description: Update the project's automatic learning/memory artifacts from a session (defaults to latest)
skills.name: learning-update

skills.description: Bootstrap a repo for at by generating CLAUDE.md, .claude/project.yaml, baseline rules under .claude/rules/at/, a repo-owned rules pack under .claude/rules/project/, and docs scaffolding (docs registry + PROJECT_CONTEXT). Use when setting up a new repo for session-based workflows and corporate-grade Python/Go/TypeScript/Rust commands.
skills.name: project-bootstrapper

skills.description: Interview the user and generate repo-specific "project pack" rules under .claude/rules/project/ with corporate-grade constraints (SRP/DRY, architecture boundaries). Recommends whether hexagonal architecture is appropriate based on repo objective/complexity, asks for confirmation, and can install deterministic architecture boundary enforcement that fails the quality gate.
skills.name: project-pack-interviewer

skills.description: Prune .claude/audit_logs JSONL files (keep N days; dry-run by default)
skills.name: prune-audit-logs

skills.description: Import an existing repository into at. Auto-detects languages, package managers, linters, formatters, type checkers, test runners, and documentation. Generates project.yaml, docs registry, and PROJECT_CONTEXT.md. Use when onboarding an existing codebase.
skills.name: repo-importer
skills.notes: Merge into one import wizard; avoid duplicate flows.

skills.description: Generate a controlled retrospective from a session (quality/compliance/docs outcomes) and propose improvements to rules/docs (requires confirmation to apply)
skills.name: retrospective

skills.description: Audit workflow sessions to evaluate quality, efficiency, and generate improvement recommendations. Supports parallel analysis and historical comparison.
skills.name: session-auditor

skills.description: Generate per-session telemetry KPIs (files changed, tasks done, gate outcomes) and optionally roll up into docs/AGENTIC_KPIS.md
skills.name: session-kpis

skills.description: Install and configure at audit hooks (opt-in) for tool/session/subagent logging under .claude/audit_logs
skills.name: setup-audit-hooks
skills.notes: Consolidate into one command (keep one name, keep other as alias).

skills.description: Suggests manual context compaction at logical workflow boundaries rather than arbitrary auto-compaction
skills.name: strategic-compact
skills.notes: Low value; drop unless users request.

skills.description: Upgrade project's at configuration to the latest plugin version. Audits schema, hooks, and rules for changes, creates backups, and applies safe upgrades.
skills.name: upgrade
